result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R Wiley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid forthwith (fine and surcharge).  Alternate 15 days Jail.  Court imposes alternate.  Credit for 15 Days.  TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kevin R Wiley in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy. 
 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $379.00 
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
To be paid forthwith. Alternate 15 days Jail. Court imposes alternate. (Credit - 15 days)  TIME SERVED
